scheme_name: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Rural Livelihoods Mission
description: The Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NRLM) aims to create institutional platforms for the rural poor, especially women, to promote sustainable livelihoods through SHGs, financial inclusion, and skill development.
key_features: Formation and strengthening of womenâ€™s SHGs

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to Rs. 10 Lakhs for SHG enterprises
benefits.revolving_fund: Up to Rs. 15,000 per SHG as working capital

group_criteria: Members of registered SHGs under DAY-NRLM
economic_criteria: Must belong to Below Poverty Line (BPL) or low-income households

eligible_activities: Skill training in agriculture, handicrafts, or services

steps: Join or form an SHG under DAY-NRLM through the local Block Development Office
Submit an application through the SHG with a business plan
Attach required documents, including SHG registration and member details
Applications are reviewed by the State Rural Livelihoods Mission
Approved SHGs receive funding and support
application_process.note: Applications are processed through SHGs, not individuals

special_notes: Funding is provided to SHGs, not individuals
Priority is given to women from marginalized communities
